sentence.idiomatic: I've liked reciting poetry since I was young.
He often recites love poetry to her.
At yesterday's party he read one of Li Bo's poems aloud.
Today is the weekend, it's amazing you're up this early.
It's surprising that he wouldn't remember such an important thing.
You are from Beijing, and yet you haven't been to the Great Wall?
You can listen to music with this, and it also can serve as a USB drive.
I considered him my best friend. I never expected that he would deceive me.
If I took one of my paintings and gave it to her as a gift, would she be happy?
You are simply a genius--you learn it once and can already do it.
In the last while I've been working overtime every day. I'm really about to go crazy.
His poems are so beautifully written, I simply adore him to death.
In the winter, to sit in the garden reading a book while basking in the sun is a real pleasure.
After I retire, I would like to enjoy life at home with my spouse.
Actually, learning is also a kind of enjoyment. You can find a lot of pleasure in the learning process.
Traveling during the Golden Week is truly torture--there are people everywhere.
Being with him is torture, we have to do everything he wants.
If you don't like it, you can leave. Why stay there and be tortured?
I don't like to drink milk, but mom always forces me to drink it.
If she doesn't want to say it, don't force her to.
I hate people forcing me to do things that I don't want to do.
I forbid you to step outside of this room.
Speaking is not permitted in class.
The use of mobile phones is not permitted in the hospital.
I don't make friends with uncultured people.
You are so uneducated, I'm wasting my words on you.
You don't understand because you're uncultured. That's why you think it's boring.
What are you doing reading ``300 Tang Poems?"
I like it. Reading ancient poetry is a hobby of mine since childhood.
No way! What made me happiest about having graduated was not having to read or memorize a single ancient poem ever again. And then you go make a hobby out of it.
Yeah! Such beautiful language--how could it not invoke emotion in you? Reciting poetry is just such a pleasure.

To me it's torture. Just after learning to talk, my parents forced me to memorize Tang poetry. After starting school, not only did I have to memorize it, I also had to write it. I wasn't allowed to get a single character wrong. So tell me how I'm going to fall in love with poetry.
I'm not like you... I've liked poetry since I was little, and especially ancient poetry.
So what poets do you like?
So many! From Tang Dynasty, I like Li Bai and Du Fu. From Song Dynasty, I like Su Shi.
Anyway, I just hate poetry.
Ah, you're really so uneducated.
